intro: Jasione montana var. bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteate bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, inconspicuous bracts beneath the flowers. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
